data.title: Descendants of King John
data.text:
This is a survey of descendants of King John of England until approximately the end of the Wars of the Roses in 1485. It is not intended to be complete; I have omitted many children and lines of descent, but have tried to include all those with historical significance. Issue of foreign marriages is included only to the extent that they are of interest to English genealogy. In cases in which descendants married other descendants included in this survey, the respective spouses are marked with asterisks, or with the words “above” or “below”. Generally, the issue of the marriages of two descendants are listed under the father.

John "Lackland", 1199 King of England (Beaumont Palace, Oxford 24 Dec 1167-Newark Castle 19 Oct 1216; bur Worcester Cathedral); m.1st Marlebridge 29 Aug 1189 (annulled 1199/1200) Isabella, Css of Gloucester (d.1217; bur Canterbury Cathedral), dau of William, Earl of Gloucester (and later wife of Geoffrey de Mandeville, Earl of Essex, and of Hubert de Burgh, Earl of Kent); m.2nd Bordeaux 24 Aug 1200 Isabelle (d.Fontevrault 31 May 1246; bur there), dau of Aymar Tallefer, Cte d'Angoulême (and later wife of Hugues de Lusignan, Cte de la Marche)

1a) Henry III, 1216 King of England (WinchesterCastle1 Oct 1207-Westminster Palace 16 Nov 1272; bur Westminster Abbey); m.Canterbury 14 Jan 1236 Eleonore of Provence (Aix-en-Provence ca 1217-Amesbury 24 Jun 1291; bur Amesbury)

1b) Edward I, 1272 King of England (Westminster Palace 17/18 Jun 1239-Burgh-on-the-Sands, nr Carlisle 7 Jul 1307; bur Westminster Abbey); m.1st Burgos 18 Oct 1254 Leonor (ca 1244-Herdeby Lincs 29 Nov 1290; bur Westminster Abbey), dau of King Fernando III of Castile and Léon; m.2nd Canterbury 8 Sep 1299 Marguerite (1275/9-Marlborough Castle 14 Feb 1317; bur Grey Friars, London), dau of King Philippe III of France

1c) Eleanor (Windsor17 Jun 1264-Ghent12 Oct 1297; bur Westminster Abbey); m.1st King Alfonso III of Aragón (d.18 Jun 1291); m.2nd Bristol 20 Sep 1293 Henri III Ct of Bar (d.Sep 1302)

1d) Edward I, Ct of Bar (1296-Famagusta 11 Nov 1336; bur Famagusta); m.Montbard 11 Feb 1310 Marie (b.1298, d.after 1323, byr Bar-le-Duc), dau of Robert II, Duc de Bourgogne à issue, including:

1e) Henry IV, Ct of Bar (d.Paris 24 Dec 1344; bur St.Maxe, Bar-le-Duc); m.Yolande (d.Nieppe 12 Dec 1395), dau of Robert of Flanders, Cte de Marle (and later wife of Philippe of Navarre Cte de Longueville) à issue, including:

1f) Robert I, Ct of Bar, 1354 Duke of Bar, Mgve of Pont-à-Mousson (8 Nov 1344-12 Apr 1411; bur St.Maxe, Bar-le-Duc); m.Bar le Duc 5 Oct 1364 Marie (Saint-Germain-en-Laye 18 Sep 1344-2 Jan 1404; bur Bar-le-Duc), dau of King Jean II of France à issue, including:

1g) Henry, sn d’Oisy (Bar-le-Duc ca 1367-k.a.Treviso Nov 1398; bur Couvent aux Célestines, Paris); m.Marie*** (d.after 3 Mar 1405; see below), dau of Enguerrand de Coucy, Earl of Bedford, granddaughter of King Edward III of England à issue
